name: Truth or Dare Online Quiz | Mixed 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.text: You want to start with a truth. Which of these statements is the true statement?
questions.correct: A baby swan is called a cygnet.
options: A baby horse is called a pup.
A baby deer is called a cub.
A baby lion is called a calf.
questions.explanation:
A baby swan is called a cygnet.

	Cygnets and swans belong to the same family as geese and ducks. A swan can lay 3-8 eggs at a time.

questions.text: Do you want a dare this time? Alright, this is what you must do. Kiss a dead person. I see you are smart, you kissed the president on the twenty dollar bill (American money). He is indeed dead, but what is his name?
questions.explanation:
Andrew Jackson.

	Andrew Jackson was the seventh president of the United States. His nickname was "Old Hickory" because of his toughness. Jackson said he only had two regrets, not shooting Henry Clay and not hanging John C. Calhoun.

questions.text: Time for another truth. This time complete this quote about truth by Mark Twain. "Truth is the most _________ thing we have." What goes in the blank?
questions.explanation:
valuable.

	Mark Twain's real name was Samuel Clemens.  He got his pen name from a nautical term. His best known works are "The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn" and "The Adventures of Tom Sawyer." The nautical term mark twain means two fathoms, it is a shortened form of "markin' the twine".

questions.text: And now you are ready for another dare. Alright, I dare you "para cocer al horno su pie". What is it you are going to go bake if you want to get this dare won?
questions.explanation:
your foot.

	Pie is the Spanish word for foot. If I wanted a pie I would have said empanada. Pie in Spanish is what is known as a false cognate. It looks like the English word pie, but does not mean a pie. An example of a real cognate is the word telefono, it looks like and means telephone.

questions.text: I'll give you another truth this time. Once again which of these statements is the true one?
questions.correct: Kirstie Alley was born in Kansas.
options: Patrick Swayze was born in Arizona.
Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen were born in Vermont.
John Travolta was born in Wyoming.
questions.explanation:
Kirstie Alley was born in Kansas.

	According to wikipedia.com Kirstie Alley was born January 12, 1951, her year of birth in other sources such as Ladies Home Journal have given the year of her birth as 1955. She was born in Wichita, KS. Patrick Swayze was born August 18, 1952 in Houston, TX. He died in 2009 from pancreatic cancer.Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen were born on June 13, 1986 in Sherman Oaks, California. They are not identical twins, as they get older this is becoming more noticeable. Ashley is right-handed, while Mary-Kate is left handed. Ashley is two minutes older than her sister, Mary-Kate. John Travolta was born February 18, 1954 in Englewood, NJ. His oldest son Jett's death as a result of a seizure sparked a lot of controversy about John Travolta's religion of Scientology. He and wife, Kelly Preston, also have a daughter Ella Bleu born in 2000 and a son Benjamin born in 2010.

questions.text: I dare you to challenge this NBA player to a game of basketball. He was the first to score 100 points on his own in one game.
questions.explanation:
Wilt Chamberlain.

	Wilt Chamberlain was born August 21, 1936 in Philadelphia, PA. He played basketball with the Philadelphia 76ers from 1965-1968 and then with the LA Lakers from 1968-1973. In 1978 he was inducted into the Basketball Hall of Fame.

questions.text: Who said this quote in a movie, "Lies only become truth if other person chooses to believe them."?
options: Col. Jessep in "A Few Good Men"
questions.explanation:
Mr. Miyagi in "Karate Kid II"

	All the movies listed contain a line with the word truth. Col. Jessep's line from "A Few Good Men" is of course "You can't handle the truth!". In "Jesus Christ Superstar" Pilate says to Jesus, "But what is truth?" In the movie "Aladdin", Aladdin does not know how to get Princess Jasmine, and keeps telling her lies. Genie's suggestion: "Tell her the TRUTH!". Mr. Miyagi was played by Noriyuki "Pat" Morita who was born on June 28, 1932 in Isleton, California. As a child, at the age of 2 he had tuberculosis and it was thought he would never walk. He was able to walk again by age 11.

questions.text: And you have chosen another dare. Let me think. Ah yes, I dare you to ask the winner of the 1999 Oscar for best actor for his autograph. Whose autograph should you get?
questions.explanation:
Roberto  Benigni.

	All were nominated that year along with Ed Norton, but the award went to Mr. Benigni for his portrayal of Guido Orefice in "Life is Beautiful" in which he plays a Jewish man with a sense of humor that helps him get his son through a Nazi concentration camp.

questions.text: You have picked a truth again. Which of the following is the correct chemical symbol for its element?
questions.explanation:
Fe is Iron.

	Fe gets its symbol for the Latin word for iron ferrum. Tb is the chemical symbol for Terbium which was discovered in 1843 by Carl Mosander. The chemical symbol for Calcium is Ca. Pb is the chemical symbol for Lead, while Radium is Ra. Sn is not Silver, but Tin. The chemical symbol for Silver is Ag.

questions.text: Our game is coming to an end and you have chosen to be brave and take a dare as your last question. I dare you to eat some "Toxicodendron radicans". What would you have to eat to win this dare?
questions.explanation:
Poison Ivy.

	Poison ivy is not real ivy. It can come in tree forms, a shrub, or a trailing vine, or a climbing vine. To most people its poison causes an itchy rash on the skin it comes in contact with.
